marklogic.body:
Â So, do I also have the right to shoot your kid when he's walking home from the corner store? Maybe I'm having an Anxiety attack ... so I feel threatened. Or maybe he's wearing a shirt I think looks "Off" or has a message on it I don't agree with. Maybe he's wearing a NRA tee and I just assume he's violent or "carrying" and so that makes me feel threatened.
Do I have the right to shoot (and kill) your kid under any of those circumstances?
If I don't have the right to shoot your kid just because I'm the nervous type, then the right to bear - and shoot - is not unlimited. That's where gun control comes in.
